entities.name: grubbly-plank
entities.description: Professor Grubbly-Plank is mentioned as a teacher who has a different approach to teaching, with an emphasis on safety. The text states that 'a very small, unbiased part of him knew that they had good reason: Grubbly-Plank's idea of an interesting class was not one where there was a risk that somebody might have their head ripped off.' This suggests that Grubbly-Plank's teaching style is more cautious and less likely to result in injury.
